Articles.Content: What does this button on the main facility screen do? Clicking it seems to have 3 modes but I have no idea what it does!?

That would be a graphical bug. A tech node graphic carried over into the space center view.

(OT: The way you angled that screenshot, it kinda looks like Sim City 4. )

Huh, interesting. Can't say I've seen that in 0.22 or 0.23. Are you using any plugins that may be causing an issue, otherwise have you got any reproduction steps to get it to occur again?

Thanks!
I have noticed an increased occurance of these 'carryovers' as well. A map-view line here, a black box or a stray button there. No definite reproduction steps unfortunately
I haven't had any carry overs and I am running a butt ton of mods.
I saw that above shown carry over from the science lab, too ...but afaik only once so far
Not sure if it's the same, but I've had the space center models appear in the SPH. Not sure if this is linked to the button staying around problem.

Not sure if it's the same, but I've had the space center models appear in the SPH. Not sure if this is linked to the button staying around problem.

http://i.imgur.com/UFigmeD.png

The Space Centre models appearing in the editor is most likely from the KerbTown plugin. I've seen many reports of that from users with that plugin installed.

The Space Centre models appearing in the editor is most likely from the KerbTown plugin. I've seen many reports of that from users with that plugin installed.

I am getting the same bug, and I don't have KerbTown installed.

I thought it was due to the RCS/Dry CoM plugin, that was updated and it isn't that.

I am getting the same bug, and I don't have KerbTown installed.

I thought it was due to the RCS/Dry CoM plugin, that was updated and it isn't that.

Hmm that is odd. Any plugins at all installed? If so, uninstall them and see if it persists. The dry CoM plugin should be okay, but to be safe give that an uninstall.

If you would like, feel free to PM me your output_log and I'll have a check over it to see if we can figure out what causes it.

The Space Centre models appearing in the editor is most likely from the KerbTown plugin. I've seen many reports of that from users with that plugin installed.

It might be that this is a stock bug that is getting amplified by kerbtown.
